unnormalised: **Social Media & Influencer Marketing: Brand Collabs Getting WILD!**
normalised: **Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Brand Collaborations Getting WILD!**

unnormalised: Okay, folks, you won't BELIEVE the brand collaborations popping up on your Insta feeds lately! Remember when it was just some lipsticks? Now, it's chaat masala partnering with a fitness app for a "Spice Up Your Workout" campaign! Seriously.
normalised: Okay, folks, you won't BELIEVE the brand collaborations popping up on your Insta feeds lately! Remember when it was just some lipsticks? Now, it's chaat masala partnering with a fitness app for a "Spice Up Your Workout" campaign! Seriously.

unnormalised: This week, we've seen everything from Chennai-based designer Anita Dongre teaming up with a gaming company for virtual Onam celebrations to a biryani chain from Hyderabad collaborating with a travel influencer for a "100 km Biryani Trail." Talk about niche!
normalised: This week, we've seen everything from Chennai-based designer Anita Dongre teaming up with a gaming company for virtual Onam celebrations to a biryani chain from Hyderabad collaborating with a travel influencer for a "one hundred kilometer Biryani Trail." Talk about niche!

unnormalised: Industry experts are saying these unusual partnerships are key to grabbing eyeballs in a super saturated market. Apparently, the weirder, the better! Brands are even tapping micro-influencers with as little as 1000 followers – the key is authenticity.
normalised: Industry experts are saying these unusual partnerships are key to grabbing eyeballs in a super saturated market. Apparently, the weirder, the better! Brands are even tapping micro-influencers with as little as one thousand followers – the key is authenticity.

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the AI-powered influencer campaigns! It's a whole new level of crazy.
normalised: And don't even get me started on the A I powered influencer campaigns! It's a whole new level of crazy.

unnormalised: Are these partnerships just for the likes, or are they actually working? Tell us what YOU think in the comments!
normalised: Are these partnerships just for the likes, or are they actually working? Tell us what YOU think in the comments!
